artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Matsui Eikichi; Carver: Noguchi Enkatsu
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 489; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 310, p. 300
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; frowning man with legs wide apart, resting his sword on the ground and leaning on it; man has bleeding wound on head; man wears portion of lavender, white, black and red armor with yellow floral kimono beneath it; many arrows flying across picture plane; pale silhouettes of trees and mountain in background
dimension: 14 1/4 × 9 15/16 in. (36.2 × 25.24 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年 {Yoshitoshi} | Carver’s seal: 円活刀{Enkatsu tō}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: Portrait of the actor Ichikawa Danjūrō IX (1838-1903) as Kusunoki Taitō Masatsura (1326-1348) being killed at the Battle of Shijōnawate near Nara in 1348.
title: Theater Reformation: Stories Gleaned at Yoshino, Picture of Kusunoki Masatsura Dying at the Battle of Shijōnawate
